report.title: All User Groups
report.description: A list of groups that are associated with a user, or all users for a website.
report.query: SELECT #columns# FROM person_attribute_values pav JOIN termlists_terms tt on tt.id = pav.int_value AND tt.deleted = false JOIN termlists tl ON tl.id = tt.termlist_id AND tl.id = #group_termlist_id# AND tl.deleted=false JOIN terms t ON t.id = tt.term_id AND t.deleted=false LEFT JOIN people p on p.id = pav.person_id AND p.deleted=false LEFT JOIN users u ON u.person_id=p.id #joins# WHERE 1=1 #filters# AND pav.deleted=false AND pav.person_attribute_id=#person_group_attr_id# AND #website_filter#
report.params:
tt.id=#group_id#
--Note am using the name the_user_id as just using user_id seems to pickup the current user's id automatically which isn't what we want at all
u.id=#the_user_id#
report.columns:
--note: Do not rename this as user_id as there appears to be automatic code associated with the website filter that looks for that name
--Default to invisible as this field was added later and don't want to affect old reports
